+#ifndef TENSORFLOW_CONTRIB_TENSORRT_CONVERT_CONVERT_GRAPH_H_
+#define TENSORFLOW_CONTRIB_TENSORRT_CONVERT_CONVERT_GRAPH_H_
+
+#include <string>
+#include <vector>
+
+#include "tensorflow/core/framework/graph.pb.h"
+#include "tensorflow/core/lib/core/status.h"
+
+namespace tensorrt {
+namespace convert {
+
+tensorflow::Status ConvertGraphDefToTensorRT(
+    const tensorflow::GraphDef& graph_def,
+    const std::vector<std::string>& output_names, size_t max_batch_size,
+    size_t max_workspace_size, tensorflow::GraphDef* new_graph_def);
body: As of now, TensorRT doesn't have a API to use external allocator but they are aware of the situation and will try to push the api as soon as possible. Once it is available, we will use TF allocators to allocate memory. Until then, users will have to set a different allocation strategy, for example incremental allocation or fixed percentage allocation.
body_html: As of now, TensorRT doesn't have a API to use external allocator but they are aware of the situation and will try to push the api as soon as possible. Once it is available, we will use TF allocators to allocate memory. Until then, users will have to set a different allocation strategy, for example incremental allocation or fixed percentage allocation.
body_text: As of now, TensorRT doesn't have a API to use external allocator but they are aware of the situation and will try to push the api as soon as possible. Once it is available, we will use TF allocators to allocate memory. Until then, users will have to set a different allocation strategy, for example incremental allocation or fixed percentage allocation.
